column100:
Do you have experience with logistics management? Do you want to be part of the growth journey of an international company helping to accelerate the world's green transition to renewable energy forms? Then keep reading. 
 About Bladt 
 Bladt Industries manufactures steel foundations and offshore substations to order for offshore wind farms worldwide. Our projects stand out for their physical size, scope and budget. They are handled in teams by project managers, specialists and support functions, and interface with our own production, suppliers and subcontractors – and of course our clients, who include some of the world's largest energy companies. We must constantly be at the forefront of development and maintain a clear focus on high quality, efficient and agile business processes and on-time delivery. We have been very successful with many orders in 2021, which is why our organisation is growing considerably with an emphasis on our three sites in Denmark: Aalborg, Lindø and Brøndby. 
 What can you expect from the job? As our new Transport & Logistics Manager at Lindø, in addition to being the personnel manager for your own team, you will be responsible for e.g. coordinating the loading and unloading of ships and barges in collaboration with a project team. In addition, you will be preparing daily transport schedules as well as transport and lifting instructions in collaboration with the PTA team, while ensuring that all employees comply with these. 
 Your responsibilities 
 In addition to the above, your tasks will include: 
 
 Coordinating gantry crane schedules and optimisation of do 
 Coordinating SPMT internally/externally 
 Collaborating with QHSE and the production team to ensure preparation of RAMS 
 Negotiating with external suppliers 
 Holding Toolbox meetings 
 Holding and participating in recruitment interviews with potential employees 
 Personnel management for your own team 
 
 Working with our Operations Manager, you will have great influence over tasks in the production process and thus enjoy a close collaboration with many different professional groups. 
 Who are you? You have experience in logistics management as well as a background in a relevant trade or technical field – preferably with knowledge of the steel industry. 
 Your qualifications and competences also include: 
 
 Knowledge of gantry crane lifting and SPMT driving 
 Knowledge of equipment maintenance 
 Good English skills, both oral and written 
 Experience with the Microsoft Office suite 
 Experienced user of AutoCAD & Inventor 
 Experience of personnel management 
 
 What we offer At Bladt Industries, we focus on being an attractive and motivating workplace with opportunities to develop. We do everything to attract and retain skilled employees. You will join a professional workplace with an informal tone, where we value cooperation, a sense of humour and a positive attitude. At Bladt, we offer a work-life balance where flexibility works both ways, and where you will enjoy great freedom with responsibility to organise your own tasks. 
 An attractive salary and employment conditions are negotiated individually, based on experience and qualifications. In addition, we offer canteen schemes, pension schemes, an active staff association, health insurance and various other staff benefits. 
 Application Has this piqued your interest? Then send us your application and CV today via email to  job@bladt.dk.   Subject: "Transport & Logistics Manager". 
 We process applications on an ongoing basis, and will end the process once we find the right candidate. 
 We look forward to hearing from you! 
 Questions? If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Operations Manager Henrik Victor Hansen on tel. +45 41 88 37 07 or HR Partner Charlotte H. Willumsen on tel. +45 40 23 33 87. 
 About Bladt Industries 
 Bladt Industries ranks among the biggest companies in the world in offshore wind. Over the last 25 years, we have delivered more than 2,500 offshore wind turbine foundations, corresponding to more than a third of the world's offshore wind turbines, as well as a significant number of offshore substations. Bladt Industries is the foundation of the green offshore transition.
